comment: [[User:Sietse_Snel/Fix_common_mistakes|fix double 'the'. please help us fix common mistakes in the article space]]

diff.*:
Line 17: Line 17:  
Traditionally, wisdom is related to [[virtue]]. It is [[tautology|tautological]] that it is wise to be virtuous. Some philosophers believe that virtues harmonize, that is, in order to succeed at any virtue, one must succeed somewhat at all of them. In this view, sages must have virtues such as [[humility]], [[compassion]], [[composure]], and being able to [[laugh]] at oneself. Many [[liberal]]s and [[religion]]s select a wider set of virtues for sages, including [[charity|impartial love]], [[tolerance]] for dissonance, [[paradox]], [[nuance]], [[ambiguity]] and [[uncertainty]].
 
Traditionally, wisdom is related to [[virtue]]. It is [[tautology|tautological]] that it is wise to be virtuous. Some philosophers believe that virtues harmonize, that is, in order to succeed at any virtue, one must succeed somewhat at all of them. In this view, sages must have virtues such as [[humility]], [[compassion]], [[composure]], and being able to [[laugh]] at oneself. Many [[liberal]]s and [[religion]]s select a wider set of virtues for sages, including [[charity|impartial love]], [[tolerance]] for dissonance, [[paradox]], [[nuance]], [[ambiguity]] and [[uncertainty]].
    −
Some people say that the the most universally and usefully-wise sages sense, work with and align themselves and others to [[life]]. In this view, sages help people appreciate the intrinsic [[wholeness]] and [[interconnectedness]] of life.
+
Some people say that the most universally and usefully-wise sages sense, work with and align themselves and others to [[life]]. In this view, sages help people appreciate the intrinsic [[wholeness]] and [[interconnectedness]] of life.
     
Classically, wisdom is considered to come with age. Some [[religion]]s consider wisdom a gift granted by [[God]]. The [[Jew]]ish book of [[Proverbs]] in the [[Old Testament]] states `Fear of God is the beginning of Wisdom`.
 
Classically, wisdom is considered to come with age. Some [[religion]]s consider wisdom a gift granted by [[God]]. The [[Jew]]ish book of [[Proverbs]] in the [[Old Testament]] states `Fear of God is the beginning of Wisdom`.
